content.body: Does anyone have good writeups on why "you should use URL/URIs as your API's unique ID format" turned out poorly and has mostly been abandoned? Maybe hsivonen?

content.body:
> <@domenicdenicola:matrix.org> Does anyone have good writeups on why "you should use URL/URIs as your API's unique ID format" turned out poorly and has mostly been abandoned? Maybe hsivonen?

I think I don't have a blog post of that kind. I don't recall if I've written a public-html email like that long ago or not. Sorry.

content.body: Every task has [script evaluation environment settings object set](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#script-evaluation-environment-settings-object-set). What is this case when task has in set more than one  environment settings object? I couldn't find anything that would be match with that case.

content.body: is it expected that platform.html5.org is down? is there anything else similar (e.g., derived from `w3c/browser-specs`) that is up? (cc annevk given AFAIK it's his server or at least domain?)

content.body:
Sam Sneddon [:gsnedders]: coincidentally, I’ve been working on an update to platform.html5.org, so I do have something similar and I can have it up pretty shortly

…and as far as platform.html5.org itself, it’s not expected that it should be down — I think there’s some intermittent problem at Dreamhost that’s causing it to go down, but I don’t have the access to troubleshoot it.

The DNS is through Dreamhost but it’s just a CNAME to an address on the whatwg.org infrastructure.

content.body: sideshowbarker: curious, what does the number in Docs column mean?
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: curious, what does the number in Docs column mean?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: sideshowbarker: curious, what does the number in Docs column mean?
sideshowbarker: curious, what does the number in Docs column mean?

content.body: it’s the number of MDN articles which reference the given spec
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it’s the number of MDN articles which reference the given spec

content.body: Can one see the references in MDN somewhere?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Can one see the references in MDN somewhere?

content.body: those are in data files; e.g., https://w3c.github.io/mdn-spec-links/accelerometer.json
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: those are in data files; e.g., https://w3c.github.io/mdn-spec-links/accelerometer.json

content.body: I guess I can add links to those too

content.body: the keys in those data files are IDs/anchors in the spec
